page.title: 04LITTLE MARCLE FARMING (2)
page.content: {Hops } Several farms have flourishing hop fields, which are protected from strong winds by high hedges. The permanent poles are strung in spring & the vines climb clockwise. They are harvested mechanically in late September & taken by trailer to the hop kilns. Here the hops are automatically separated from the stalks & leaves & spread over canvas in the kiln for some hours at a controlled temperature to dry over a furnace. They are then spread out to cool before being compressed & packed into "hop pockets". Hops are susceptible to a disease called Verticillium Wilt which occurs in this area. Precautionary "Keep Out" notices protect most hop fields.
